main event: The reported sighting occurred on August 7, 1952, near Port Lyautey, French Morocco. It involved three naval officers observing brilliant white objects moving at terrific speed in the sky, estimated at the size of a bomber.
interesting points: The objects were observed for approximately 30 minutes, showing no lights and making no sound, and appeared to be under intelligent control.
The weather observations for the period were generally excellent with high or variable ceilings and good visibility.
A detailed description was provided of a preliminary investigation involving a circular object, indicating potential intelligent control.
Witnesses described a brilliant white light traveling at a tremendous speed, with observers attempting to close the range but finding it impossible due to the object's high rate of speed.
The text also implies a potential lack of acknowledgement or attention from the Air Force regarding the reported sightings.
sighted object: brilliant white objects moving at terrific speed
photographs: no photographs included in the report
